formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Standard ring torus volume Using Pappus's centroid theorem or direct integration, the volume of a ring torus is: \[ V = 2 \pi^2 R r^2 \]

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: \[ R = \frac{R_{\text{out}} + R_{\text{in}}}{2}, \qquad r = \frac{R_{\text{out}} - R_{\text{in}}}{2} \] \[ V = 2 \pi^2 R r^2 \]

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: \[ V = 2 \pi^2 R r^2 = 2 \pi^2 \cdot 0.5 \cdot (0.1)^2 \approx 0.0987 \, \text{m}^3 \] which corresponds to about \(98.7 \, \text{liters}\).
